title: Red Sox have reportedly discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks in search of an infielder
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox are considering trading reliever Jordan Hicks and starters Brayan Bello, Patrick Sandoval for an infielder.
Boston seeks infield reinforcements, connecting with players like Nico Hoerner, Eugenio Suarez, and Isaac Paredes.
Pitcher Jordan Hicks, acquired in 2025, posted an 8.20 ERA and is set to earn $12.5 million in 2026.

title: Breakout Patriots LB K’Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with New England in free agency
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots linebacker K’Lavon Chaisson aims to re-sign with New England in free agency after a standout season.
Chaisson recorded 7.5 sacks, 18 quarterback hits, and 10 tackles for loss during the regular season with the Patriots.
Chaisson expressed gratitude towards offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels and interim defensive coordinator Zak Kuhr for their support.

title: Patriots DC Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after four months battling prostate cancer
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots defensive coordinator Terrell Williams was declared cancer-free after a four-month battle with prostate cancer.
Williams was diagnosed in September with an aggressive prostate cancer that had spread throughout his body.
Williams will join the Patriots for Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara after not traveling with the team this season.

title: Cambridge becomes first Mass. city to endorse Plant Based Treaty — but what does that mean?
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Cambridge City Council unanimously endorses the Plant Based Treaty, becoming the first city in Massachusetts to support the initiative.
The treaty aims for a global agreement to complement the Paris Agreement and promote sustainable food systems, starting with local policy changes.
Endorsement focuses on awareness, reducing emissions, and public health benefits without mandating specific actions, involving city staff and volunteers.

title: 5 Catherine O’Hara movies and TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Catherine O'Hara, known for roles in 'Schitt's Creek' and 'Home Alone,' passed away at 71 from a brief illness.
'Schitt’s Creek,' starring O'Hara as Moira Rose, is available on Hulu and Prime Video, notable for its Emmy sweep.
O'Hara's performance in 'A Mighty Wind' as a fictional folk duo member is streaming free with ads on YouTube.

title: Mike Vrabel doesn’t buy that Patriots’ white uniforms provide good luck: ‘Hope the tooth fairy comes tonight’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel dismisses the superstition about white uniforms bringing good luck.
Patriots chose to wear white uniforms for Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks, with a 5-0 record in them this season.
Super Bowl history shows teams wearing white jerseys are 37-22; however, Seahawks are 6-0 in navy blue this season.

title: Dave Epstein on how this Atlantic winter storm will impact Mass. — and how it largely won’t
author: David Epstein
bullets: A massive nor’easter will form off the Carolina coast but will largely miss New England.
Cape Cod and the Islands may see 2 to 6 inches of snow with gusts up to 55 mph.
A coastal flood watch is issued for Eastern Massachusetts due to potential minor to moderate flooding.

title: Celtics reportedly unlikely to take ‘huge swings’ ahead of NBA trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to make significant trades before Feb. 5 deadline, per ESPN's Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst.
Boston might trade guard Anfernee Simons, making $27.7 million this season, to improve the roster.
Celtics could target Clippers center Ivica Zubac in a trade involving Simons and draft picks.

title: These 5 Boston restaurants received all-alcohol licenses under new legislation
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Five Boston restaurants received all-alcohol licenses under new legislation, allowing them to serve spirits and cocktails.
The approval is part of a 2026 Massachusetts budget provision, initiated by Rep. Aaron Michlewitz, enabling license upgrades.
Non-transferable licenses ensure returns to the city, bypassing Boston's private market due to a cap on new liquor licenses.

title: Entangled right whale found dead off North Carolina coast
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 4-year-old North Atlantic right whale named Division was found dead off North Carolina, entangled in fishing gear.
The whale was first entangled in December 2025, injuring its blowhole and mouth, before dying despite partial rescue attempts.
It's the first North Atlantic right whale death since May 2024, highlighting ongoing risks from human activities, according to NOAA.
